title: Robe, 19th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: supplementary weft pile (velveteen); lining printed by engraved roller; facings tied resist patterning in warp (ikat)
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt
description: Red and white striped velveteen robe with a full skirt pleated into a narrow waist and deep set sleeves narrowing to the wrist. Edged with black cotton twill that is machine stitched in light blue and white. Lined with printed cotton with stripes and polka dots in red, green and yellow. Facings of silk warp ikat.

tombstone.epitaph:
Robe, 19th century.
19th century. Medium: cotton
Technique: supplementary weft pile (velveteen); lining printed by engraved roller; facings tied resist patterning in warp (ikat). Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt. 1931-4-66.
